Title: Create Comprehensive Test Infrastructure
Description: 26,554 lines with only 1 test file (conftest.py). BLOCKER for production. Must create complete test infrastructure.
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Create tests/ directory structure
2. Create pytest.ini
3. Create 60+ test files
4. Achieve >80% coverage
5. All tests pass
Technical Details: Current: 1 test file (conftest.py). Need: 60+ test files for 25+ services, ML models, GNN, rules engine.
TDD Requirements: RED: Create test infrastructure. GREEN: Validate tests work. REFACTOR: Optimize.
Test Files: tests/unit/ (40 files), tests/integration/ (15 files), tests/ml/ (5 files)
Step By Step Instructions: 1. Create tests/ structure 2. Create pytest.ini 3. Write critical tests first 4. Continue systematically 5. Monitor coverage 6. Document
Best Practices: Follow TDD, use fixtures, mock external services, test all error paths
AI Clarification Points: Target 80% or 90% coverage? Which services are most critical?
Scientific Method Steps: RED: Create infrastructure. GREEN: Write tests. REFACTOR: Optimize. VALIDATE: >80% coverage.

Title: Test ML Models Accuracy
Description: ML fraud models have no accuracy tests. Cannot validate fraud detection reliability.
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Create ML test dataset (1000+ transactions)
2. Test model accuracy (>99%)
3. Test false positive rate (<1%)
4. Test false negative rate (<0.1%)
5. Document accuracy metrics
Technical Details: Current: ML models untested. Need: test dataset, accuracy validation, false positive/negative measurement. Target: >99% accuracy, <1% false positives.
TDD Requirements: RED: Create test dataset. GREEN: Validate accuracy. REFACTOR: Improve models.
Step By Step Instructions: 1. Create test dataset 2. Test ML models 3. Measure accuracy 4. Measure false positive/negative 5. Improve models if needed 6. Document
Best Practices: Use real-world fraud scenarios, test edge cases, validate against known fraud patterns
AI Clarification Points: What accuracy is acceptable? False positive tolerance? Test with real data?
Scientific Method Steps: RED: Test accuracy. GREEN: Validate >99%. REFACTOR: Improve. VALIDATE: Production-ready accuracy.
Ask Questions When: REQUIRES_INTERVENTION: BUSINESS_RULE - Acceptable fraud detection accuracy?

Title: Test GNN Fraud Ring Detection
Description: GNN (Graph Neural Network) for fraud ring detection untested. Cannot validate fraud ring identification.
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Create fraud ring test cases
2. Test GNN fraud ring detection
3. Measure detection accuracy
4. Test false positive fraud rings
5. Document GNN performance
Technical Details: Current: GNN untested. Need: fraud ring test cases, detection accuracy measurement. Test: known fraud rings, legitimate connections.
TDD Requirements: RED: Create test cases. GREEN: Validate GNN. REFACTOR: Improve.
Step By Step Instructions: 1. Research fraud ring patterns 2. Create test cases 3. Test GNN detection 4. Measure accuracy 5. Improve if needed 6. Document
Best Practices: Use real fraud ring patterns, test legitimate connections (avoid false positives), validate graph analysis
AI Clarification Points: How to create realistic fraud ring test data? Acceptable accuracy?
Scientific Method Steps: RED: Test GNN. GREEN: Validate detection. REFACTOR: Improve. VALIDATE: Accurate fraud ring detection.

Title: Test Rules Engine
Description: Dynamic rules engine untested. Rules may fail silently causing false negatives.
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Test all fraud rules
2. Test rule combinations
3. Test rule priority
4. Test dynamic rule updates
5. All tests pass
Technical Details: Current: Rules engine untested. Need: test all static and dynamic rules, test combinations, validate priority.
TDD Requirements: RED: Write failing tests. GREEN: Fix bugs. REFACTOR: Improve.
Step By Step Instructions: 1. Study rules engine 2. Write tests for all rules 3. Test combinations 4. Test priority 5. Fix bugs 6. Document
Best Practices: Test all rules individually, test combinations, validate priority, test dynamic updates
AI Clarification Points: How many rules exist? Rule priority logic? Dynamic update frequency?
Scientific Method Steps: RED: Test rules. GREEN: Fix bugs. REFACTOR: Optimize. VALIDATE: All rules work correctly.

Title: Remove Hardcoded Path (Line 20)
Description: Line 20 has hardcoded path. Breaks in different environments.
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Replace with relative path
2. Test in different environments
3. All tests pass
Technical Details: Current: Line 20 hardcoded. Fix: Use Path(__file__) or env var.
TDD Requirements: RED: Test in different env. GREEN: Fix path. REFACTOR: Use pathlib.
Step By Step Instructions: 1. Replace line 20 2. Test in different environments 3. Document
Best Practices: Use pathlib.Path, use env vars, validate paths exist
Scientific Method Steps: RED: Test fails. GREEN: Fix. REFACTOR: Use pathlib. VALIDATE: Works everywhere.

3. Document all endpoints

Best Practices: Use OpenAPI 3.0, include examples, document errors

Title: Implement Load Testing
Description: Performance at scale unknown. Need load testing to validate <600ms response time at scale.
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Create load test scenarios
2. Test at 10x expected load
3. Validate <600ms response time
4. Identify bottlenecks
5. Optimize
Technical Details: Current: <600ms claimed but not validated at scale. Load test: fraud detection API at 1000 req/sec.
TDD Requirements: RED: Set up load testing. GREEN: Identify bottlenecks. REFACTOR: Optimize.
Step By Step Instructions: 1. Define expected load 2. Create scenarios 3. Run load tests 4. Monitor performance 5. Optimize 6. Re-test 7. Document
Best Practices: Test realistic scenarios, monitor all resources, optimize bottlenecks
AI Clarification Points: Expected fraud checks/second? Acceptable response time at scale?
Scientific Method Steps: RED: Load test. GREEN: Identify bottlenecks. REFACTOR: Optimize. VALIDATE: <600ms at scale.

Title: Add CI/CD Pipeline
Description: No CI/CD. Need automated testing on every commit for fraud detection code.
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Create GitHub Actions workflow
2. Run tests on commit
3. Run linting
4. Block merge if tests fail
Technical Details: Current: No CI/CD. Implement GitHub Actions for automated testing. Critical for fraud detection quality.
TDD Requirements: RED: Create CI. GREEN: Implement testing. REFACTOR: Optimize.
Step By Step Instructions: 1. Create .github/workflows/test.yml 2. Configure Python 3. Run tests 4. Run linting 5. Configure branch protection 6. Document
Best Practices: Use caching, run tests in parallel, block merges on failures
Scientific Method Steps: RED: Create CI. GREEN: Implement. REFACTOR: Optimize. VALIDATE: Tests run on every commit.
